snippet: While some Jews worry that requiring expensive tickets for High Holy Days services keeps newcomers away, congregations face the reality that large communal events carry costs.
abstract: Mark Oppenheimer Beliefs column notes some Jews worry about expensive tickets for High Holy Days services keeping newcomers away but congregations face the reality that large communal events carry costs; most American Jews face situation every Yom Kippur where at most synagogues one must have paid annual dues or have bought special tickets.
lead_paragraph: While some Jews worry that requiring expensive tickets for High Holy Days services keeps newcomers away, congregations face the reality that large communal events carry costs.

headline.print_headline: Selling High Holy Days Tickets Is a Dilemma for Synagogues
headline.main: Selling High Holy Days Tickets Is a Dilemma for Synagogues
